Maze

Class GamePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Maze.GamePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GamePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.lang.Runnable
    JPanel extension which handles the main game loop, updates and drawing to the screen.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Thread used to handle the main game loop and character movement.

      Bonus time awarded when the character object passes over a timePoint cell.

      Buffered image container for the restart button image.

      Row value which represents current cell that will be set to hidden.

        Initial x coordinate position of the character object on the maze.

      • columnCounter

        private int columnCounter
        Column counter value which is adjusted (determines next column value) to move to the next cell in order to hide cells in the end game animation.

      • rmX

        private int rmX
        Row value which represents current cell that will be set to hidden.

      • rmY

        private int rmY
        Column value which represents current cell that will be set to hidden.

      • startTime

        private static long startTime
        The system time when the initial loop begins (updated in UpdateActualTime()).

      • levelTime

        private static int levelTime
        The level time determined based on difficulty picked by the player. This time is decremented every second.

      • bonusTime

        private static int bonusTime
        Bonus time awarded when the character object passes over a timePoint cell. Award varies depending on the difficulty picked in StartMenu.

      • printTime

        private static int printTime
        Container used to determine the correct time (integer values) to draw to the game screen.

      • totalScore

        private static int totalScore
        Score or points container determined upon completion of a level, awarded score varies depending on the difficulty picked in the StartMenu.

      • finalScreen

        private static boolean finalScreen
        Boolean which is triggered (true) when the end game menu must be drawn to screen. Signifies that the current game is over (gameOver == true).

      • running

        private boolean running
        Boolean which is triggered (true) once the main thread is initialized, signifying that the main game loop is running.

      • nextLevel

        protected static boolean nextLevel
        Boolean which is triggered (true) when the character object passes over an endPoint cell. Signifies that the character must be sent to the next level, the value is reset once the doNextLevel() is completed.
        See Also:
        doNextLevel()

      • incrementTime

        protected static boolean incrementTime
        Boolean which is triggered (true) when the character object passes over a timePoint cell. Results in levelTime time being incremented by bonusTime.
        See Also:
        levelTime, bonusTime

      • gameOver

        protected static boolean gameOver
        Boolean which is triggered (true) when levelTime becomes zero (0). Signifies that the game is over and action is taken to clear the screen and display the end game menu.
        See Also:
        levelTime, gameOver()

      • maze

        private GenMaze maze
        Contains a GenMaze object which is generated upon initialization of GamePanel or when a new level is initialized.
        See Also:
        GenMaze

      • gMaze

        private GraphicsMaze gMaze
        Contains a GraphicsMaze object which is generated upon initialization of GamePanel or when a new level is initialized. The object contains a set of RectCells which represent the actual maze that will be drawn to the screen.
        See Also:
        GraphicsMaze

      • player

        private Character player
        Contains a character object which represents the player (user).
        See Also:
        Character

      • input

        private InputHandler input
        The main input handler for this object and the character.
        See Also:
        Character, InputHandler, MoveHandler

        private java.awt.Font msgsFont
        Font object containing parameters describing the type of font used to draw score and time to the screen.

        Image object used for double buffering and drawing graphics to the screen.

        Buffered image container for the exit button image.

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage restartButton
        Buffered image container for the restart button image.

        private java.lang.Thread animator
        Thread used to handle the main game loop and character movement.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GamePanel

        public GamePanel(int mazeSize)
        Initializes the GamePanel object by adjusting panel dimensions, generating a new maze, initializing input handling and character position. Button images are loaded at this point and the main game thread is started in this.
        Parameters:
        mazeSize - Initial maze dimensions (mazeSize by mazeSize).

    • Method Detail

      • adjustDifficulty

        private void adjustDifficulty()
        Adjust the difficulty of the maze by obtaining the user's input from StartMenu. Depending on the difficulty, the levelTime, bonusTime and scoring calculations are adjusted.

      • startGame

        private void startGame()
        Main thread initialization occurs here, the thread animator is checked for a null value along with the game loops "running" status. The thread is initialized and then started and goes to run(), where the main loop begins.

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The paint method is overridden and is invoked by Swing to draw components to the screen. Double buffering is used to enable faster performance, where an image/graphic is loaded into a buffer while another is being drawn to the screen.
        Overrides:
        paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics rendering object used to draw to the window (JFrame/JPanel).

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overrides the paintComponent method in JPanel and does draw calls to the JPanel window. The paintComponent method draws the player, maze, time and score to the screen as well as the end menu screen.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics rendering object used to draw to the window (JFrame/JPanel).

      • run

        public void run()
        Overridden Runnable method which is required when starting a thread. The thread then executes the method's instructions, the main game loop execution occurs in this method, mainly, where the game (character movement) is updated and time is updated.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • gameUpdate

        private void gameUpdate()
        Updating portion of the game loop, the method updates the character's position on the screen while gameOver is false (not over) and while finalScreen is true (End game menu).

      • doExitBt

        private void doExitBt(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws an image and rectangle representing the restart game option. A constant check for intersection is done with the character object, until either the restart button or the exit button has been intersected. Upon intersection the game loop is reinitialized to start the game from the beginning.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics rendering object used to draw to the window (JFrame/JPanel).

      • doRestartBt

        private void doRestartBt(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws an image and rectangle representing the restart game option. A constant check for intersection is done with the character object, until either the restart button or the exit button has been intersected. Upon intersection the game loop is reinitialized to start the game from the beginning.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics rendering object used to draw to the window (JFrame/JPanel).

      • gameOver

        private void gameOver()
        Handles the end game animation where cells generated by the maze are wiped off the screen with a 100ms period between each wipe. The method determines the row and column of the nth cell and performs a hideCell() on that cell, the row and column is continuously decremented until the 0th cell is reached and hidden. Upon completion, the finalScreen is set to true enabling the drawing of the final menu screen (Restart/Exit menu).

      • doScore

        private void doScore(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws a string of the score to the window (JFrame/JPanel).
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics rendering object used to draw to the window (JFrame/JPanel).

      • doTime

        private void doTime(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws a string of the current game/level time to the window (JFrame/JPanel). The remaining time is also updated if there is any "bonus time", the amount of bonus time is based on the difficulty picked.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics rendering object used to draw to the window (JFrame/JPanel).

      • updateActualTime

        public static void updateActualTime()
        Calculates time based on the system time and handles inconsistencies in time (Lag). The method's main purpose is to handle the game time or level time for each maze instance that the user plays. Level time is determined by the difficulty that was initially picked by the user.

      • initLevel

        private void initLevel(int mazeSize)
        Initializes the maze, graphics maze and character's position in the maze upon creation of the GamePanel object. The maze is also centered based on the window's dimensions.

      • doNextLevel

        private void doNextLevel()
        The method is called whenever the character reaches an endpoint cell. When called, the method determines the score for completing the level (calculated based on maze size and difficulty), then checks if the maze's dimensions are below 10 by 10. If the dimensions are below this, then the maze size is incremented by one level; once the maximum (N= 10) maze size is reached then doNextLevel() will continue to generate 10 by 10 sized mazes. The method essentially reinitializes the maze, graphics maze and character position to a new maze. The new maze size is also used to determine the center position of the maze relative to the window's dimensions.

      • initializePlayer

        private int[] initializePlayer()
        Upon generation of a new maze (GenMaze/Array of Cell objects), the character's position relative to the maze must be reinitialized. Calling this method returns an array of integers (size 2) that contains within it the starting x position coordinate and starting y position coordinate.
